intro: Stenactis bellidiflora, commonly known as the bellflower of the genus Stenactis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa, particularly in South Africa and Namibia. The plant is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. Stenactis bellidiflora is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
